author: nero_eth
content:
optimistic attesting comes with complicated fork-choice modifications. Maybe this doesn't make much of a difference when thinking of ePBS x FOCIL since there's already a new modified fork-choice rule, but for delayed execution, it was not really considered because of fork choice complexities that come from potentially keeping invalid blocks in the store.
I still think the bitlist solution, with the lists in the block, is way cleaner and simpler here.

author: anderselowsson
content: Ah yes, I am totally open to the idea that delayed execution will have other ways for integrating with FOCIL that are good. I was just coming from your recent ethresearch post that discusses optimistic attestations as one of the options, and wanted to offer a comparison to ePBS there. What are you referring to with the bitlist in the block?

author: nero_eth
content:
let me look it up, it was a hackmd by francesco
edit: sorry couldn't find it but in short:
The proposer includes a bitlist indicating which IL committee members had their ILs considered. Also in block n, attesters verify that the appropriate transactions were "considered." This verification does not require execution; if all IL transactions were considered, the block is deemed "valid enough to attest to."

author: potuz
content: Francesco had this but on the payload and the AC had that evaluation. What Anders' realized (or rather I with Ander's idea for something very similar) is that the builder can include these in the bid itself, so attesters, and not the AC can immediately vote

author: anderselowsson
content:
Are we in the ePBS or delayed execution setting here? Perhaps you are referring to the mechanism where the AC votes on the bitfield? https://hackmd.io/UX7Vhsv8RTy8I49Uxez3Ng#Fork-choice

The post on ABBs outlines the similarities and makes a small comparison.

author: potuz
content: So delayed execution could in principle use the exact same mechanism of adding the bitlist to the block

author: potuz
content: the problem with delayed execution is that the payload is committed so if the bitlist is not fullfiled the situation is much more dire than in ePBS

author: potuz
content: and that's why its more complicated to make it work cleanly
